title: Computer Architecture 1
description: Questions about the basics of computer architecture

questions.question: What is the primary function of the processor (CPU) in a computer system?
Which processor unit is used to perform arithmetic and logical operations?
What are registers used for in a processor?

answers.b: Temporary storage of operands and results

questions.question: Which memory has the shortest access time?
What is the role of the processor's control unit?

answers.b: Decoding instructions and controlling their execution

questions.question: What is the instruction cycle of a processor?

answers.a: The process of storing data in memory
answers.b: The sequence of fetching, decoding, and executing instructions
answers.d: Synchronization between the processor and memory

questions.question: Which register contains the address of the next instruction?
What is the main role of the data bus?
What does the address bus carry?
Which component determines the order of instruction execution?
Which memory is used as an intermediary between the CPU and RAM?
What is the basic characteristic of RAM memory?
What does it mean that memory is volatile?

answers.b: Data is lost when power is turned off

questions.question: Which memory is used to store firmware?
What does the processor clock represent?

answers.a: The number of instructions in a program
answers.b: The speed of signal changes in the processor

questions.question: Which component stores the currently executed instruction?
What is the purpose of the MAR register?

answers.c: Storing the address of a memory location

questions.question: Which bus carries signals for system control?
What is the primary purpose of cache memory?
What does the width of the address bus determine?

answers.b: The maximum number of addressable memory locations
